Description.en: This credential is used as part of the Distributed Identity for Research (DI4R) IRMA demo in the GÉANT Trust and Identity Incubator.\nThis credential allows users to load profile information as provided by SURF Research Access Management (SRAM) into an IRMA wallet for login to your research community services.
Description.nl: Deze credential wordt gebruikt als onderdeel van de Distributed Identity for Research (DI4R) IRMA demo, wat onderdeel is van de GÉANT Trust and Identity Incubator.\nMiddels deze credential kunnen gebruikers profiel informatie van hun onderzoekssamenwerking zoals deze is vastgelegd in SURF Research Access Management (SRAM) inladen in een IRMA wallet om deze later bij hun onderzoeksdiensten te kunnen gebruiken om in te loggen.

FAQIntro.en: Add your credentials from your education or research institution to your IRMA app.
FAQIntro.nl: Voeg credentials van je onderwijs of onderzoeksinstelling toe aan je IRMA app.

FAQPurpose.en: By adding credentials from from your research collaboration(s) to your IRMA Wallet, you may gain access to services provided by your research collaboration.

FAQContent.en:
You may add the following data:
•name(s)
• e-mail addres(s)
• affiliation
• identifier(s)
• your roles and rights in the context of your collaboration
• assurance information

FAQHowto.en:
If you are a member of a research collaboration that has is using SURF SRAM to manage access to it services, you may add personal data from this collaboration to your IRMA app.

 Complete the following steps.
1. Select your own research collaboration
2. Log in at SRAM in the usual manner.
3. Confirm that you wish to add your data to IRMA. 

You now receive a card with your Research community attributes.

Description.en: A unique identification of subjects. May be either a globally-unique identifier, or a pairwise identifier suitable for more specialized uses.
A scoped identifier for a person.

ORCID iDs are persistent digital identifiers for individual researchers. Their primary purpose is to unambiguously and definitively link them with their scholarly work products. ORCID iDs are assigned, managed and maintained by the ORCID organization.
Unique persistent identifier for the user
Short, human-readably username for login to a backend systems
Identifier from the user's home organization
Public SSH key which the user has configured to log into backend systems
Specifies a person's home organization using the domain name of the organization
Preferred name of a person to be used when displaying entries.
Name strings that are the part of a person's name that is not their surname
Specifies the person's relationship(s) to the institution in broad categories such as student, faculty, staff, alum.
Specifies the person's affiliation within a particular security domain in broad categories such as student, faculty, staff, alum, etc.
User's role(s) in their home organization. Only present if supplied by the user's home institution.
URI (either URN or URL) that indicates a set of rights to specific resources.

This multi-valued claim represents identity assurance profiles, which are the set of standards that are met by an identity assertion, based on the Issuer's identity management processes, the type of authentication credential used, the strength of its binding, etc.
